posts.post_content:
Personally, as an avid Zombie fan, I don't believe ~ belongs in a Zombie deck. If you want a one drop in Zombies, I would go with **[Carrion Feeder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Carrion Feeder)** due to it's ability to shut off **[Graveborn Muse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Graveborn Muse)**, and protect your other 'bies from things like **[Path to Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path to Exile)** or **[Oblivion Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oblivion Ring)** (seeing as how a Zombie in your graveyard can be easily returned via **[Lord of the Undead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of the Undead)** or **[Unholy Grotto](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unholy Grotto)**).  
  
HOWEVER, in a budget deck, I love ~. It can kill 2/2s, and easily synergizes with other commons (like Carrion Feeder), making it a very versatile turn 1 or turn 0 drop. In a ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) deck, your creature's deaths are usually not a problem, as your usually the one killing everything anyways.

posts.post_content: (Card Rating: **4.0**) Festering Goblin can be an early game attacker while having the potential to become a pesky 1/1 creature's nightmare. By itself, the Festering Goblin is able to take out a 2/2 creature or finish off a creature granting an extra -1/-1. Because the ability does not do damage, Festering Goblin can get rid of small regenerators like [Drudge Skeletons](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drudge Skeletons) or [Will-o'-the-Wisp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Will-o'-the-Wisp). One *drawback* to this card is that the triggered ability is not optional. In other words, if your opponent has no creatures, he can destroy Festering Goblin in order to kill **two** of yours! In my **black**/**red** casual goblin deck, I try not to run goblins with a toughness of 1 that will be susceptible to this gruesome tactic, such as: [Knucklebone Witch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knucklebone Witch), [Goblin Chirurgeon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Chirurgeon), etc. Even with the new change in rules from M10, Festering Goblin still is not as effecient as the "all so famous" aut...
